verses.verse: And Hiram<WH2438> king<WH4428> of Tyre<WH6865> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to David<WH1732>, and cedar<WH730> - trees<WH6086>, and masons<WH7023>, and carpenters<WH2796>, to build<WH1129> him a house<WH1004>.

And David<WH1732> perceived<WH3045> that Jehovah<WH3068> had established<WH3559> him king<WH4428> over Israel<WH3478>; for his kingdom<WH4438> was exalted on<WH5375> high<WH4605>, for his people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>'s sake.
And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> more wives<WH802> at Jerusalem<WH3389>; and David<WH1732> begat<WH3205> more sons<WH1121> and daughters<WH1323>.
And these are the names<WH8034> of the children<WH3205> whom he had in Jerusalem<WH3389>: Shammua<WH8051>, and Shobab<WH7727>, Nathan<WH5416>, and Solomon<WH8010>,
and Ibhar<WH2984>, and Elishua<WH474>, and Elpelet<WH467>,
and Nogah<WH5052>, and Nepheg<WH5298>, and Japhia<WH3309>,
and Elishama<WH476>, and Beeliada<WH1182>, and Eliphelet<WH467>.

And when the Philistines<WH6430> heard<WH8085> that David<WH1732> was anointed<WH4886> king<WH4428> over all Israel<WH3478>, all the Philistines<WH6430> went up<WH5927> to seek<WH1245> David<WH1732>: and David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> of it<WH3318>, and went out against them<WH6440>.
Now the Philistines<WH6430> had come<WH935> and made a raid<WH6584> in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim<WH7497>.

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of God<WH430>, saying<WH559>, Shall I go up<WH5927> against the Philistines<WH6430>? and wilt thou deliver<WH5414> them into my hand<WH3027>? And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him<WH5927>, Go up; for I will deliver<WH5414> them into thy hand<WH3027>.

So they came up<WH5927> to Baal-perazim<WH1188>, and David<WH1732> smote<WH5221> them there<WH1732>; and David said<WH559>, God<WH430> hath broken<WH6555> mine enemies<WH341> by my hand<WH3027>, like the breach<WH6556> of waters<WH4325>. Therefore they called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> Baal-perazim<WH1188>.
And they left<WH5800> their gods<WH430> there<WH1732>; and David gave commandment<WH559>, and they were burned<WH8313> with fire<WH784>.
And the Philistines<WH6430> yet again<WH3254> made a raid<WH6584> in the valley<WH6010>.

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> again of God<WH430>; and God<WH430> said<WH559> unto him<WH5927>, Thou shalt not go up after<WH310> them<WH5437>: turn away from them<WH935>, and come upon them over against<WH4136> the mulberry-trees<WH1057>.

And it shall be<WH8085>, when thou hearest the sound<WH6963> of marching<WH6807> in the tops<WH7218> of the mulberry-trees<WH1057>, that then thou shalt go out<WH3318> to battle<WH4421>; for God<WH430> is gone out<WH3318> before<WH6440> thee to smite<WH5221> the host<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430>.
And David<WH1732> did<WH6213> as God<WH430> commanded<WH6680> him<WH5221>: and they smote the host<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430> from Gibeon<WH1391> even to Gezer<WH1507>.
And the fame<WH8034> of David<WH1732> went out<WH3318> into all lands<WH776>; and Jehovah<WH3068> brought<WH5414> the fear<WH6343> of him upon all nations<WH1471>.
